programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa is elected student president and immediately falls foul of Principal Skinner, who fools her into taking popular classes off the curriculum. Angry at his deception, she retaliates by calling her classmates out on strike. With the guest voice of film-maker Michael Moore

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Aale Maa Wau (Fish Out of Water)
programme.desc: The team crosses paths with a tough Texas Ranger who arrives on the island in search of his missing daughter. Kono and Adams security is compromised and Catherine receives a job offer from an old friend. Crime drama, starring Alex OLoughlin, Scott Caan and Michelle Borth

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Ka Oiaio Ma Loko (The Truth Within)

Alex OLoughlin, Scott Caan and Michelle Borth star

programme.desc: Rush convinces Young to divert from the Destinys set course to investigate when a remote energy signature is detected. programme.sub-title: Marge v Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens, and Gays

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A seemingly routine surveillance job takes a deadly turn for Catherine and her ex, Billy, leading the team to a hitman. McGarrett is desperate to find Doris, so he turns to retired Navy Seal Joe White for help in locating his elusive mother, while Adam considers giving himself up to the Yakuza to save Kono

programme.title: S.W.A.T.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer builds a robot for Bart to enter the Robot Rumble TV show, but finds the task harder than expected and resorts to trickery. Meanwhile, Lisas pet cats keep dying

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: Jan decides to sue Dunder Mifflin and Michael is called as a key witness. Kelly gives Pam a lesson in trash talking when Darryl beats Jim at table tennis

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: In the absence of a good excuse not to attend, Jim and Pam visit Michaels house for dinner, but Dwight is jealous when he discovers Angela and Andy are also invited

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge writes a novel and succeeds in getting it published to critical acclaim in the Springfield community. Homer is delighted - until he finds out its plot, which portrays him as an uncaring husband. With the guest voices of authors Tom Clancy and Thomas Pynchon

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In the long-running animations 26th Halloween special, Sideshow Bob finally kills Bart, only to reanimate him. Homer wakes up with short-term memory loss, and Lisa, Bart, and Milhouse get superpowers from radiation

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago

programme.title: Never Mind the Buzzcocks
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy quiz as Clint Boon, Patsy Kensit, Danny Goffey and guest captain Bez join regulars Noel Fielding and Jamali Maddix

programme.title: Romesh: Cant Knock the Hustle
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan explores self-improvement, celebrating his body with a Korean photoshoot and visiting a shaman and experiencing a ritual that leaves him shaken. On Vancouver Island in Canada, he heads to a retreat where he gets up close and personal with fellow men, while in Arizona he meets someone on a mission to live as long as possible. Finally, he tries his hand at being in a Tamil movie to see if beauty and health is a matter of perspective

programme.title: Brassic
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Time in Dusseldorf

programme.desc: The ATP Shanghai Masters and the WTA Wuhan Open. Coverage of the events at Qizhong Forest Sports City Arena and Optics Valley International Tennis Center respectively. There was an upset in round four in Shanghai last year when David Goffin overcame second seed Alexander Zverev 6-4, 7-5. British interest ended early in the first round in Wuhan 12 months ago when Katie Boulter was beaten 6-2, 7-5 by Lesia Tsurenko

programme.title: Live World Grand Prix Darts
programme.sub-title: World Grand Prix Darts D2 07.10 Leicester Mattioli Arena
programme.desc: Coverage of day two from Mattioli Arena in Leicester, featuring first-round matches, played over the best of three sets. Mike De Decker was the shock champion last year and he got his tournament under way 12 months ago with a 2-1 victory over Damon Heta. Later that night, six-time winner of this event Michael van Gerwen was comprehensively beaten 2-0 by Daryl Gurney

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: New Zealand v South Africa. Coverage of the group match from Holkar Cricket Stadium, Indore. New Zealand have won the World Cup just once in their history when they beat rivals Australia at the 2000 event, a tournament that they also hosted. South Africa have never won this competition before and have been beaten in the semi-finals on the last two occasions

programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the 20212 final at Wembley Stadium. programme.desc: The ATP Shanghai Masters and the WTA Wuhan Open. Coverage of the events at Qizhong Forest Sports City Arena and Optics Valley International Tennis Center respectively. Eventual Shanghai champion Jannik Sinner had to come back from a set down to defeat Tomás Martín Etcheverry in round three last year. The highest-ranked player in round one of the Wuhan Open in 2024, Beatriz Haddad Maia, was a 7-6, 6-2 victor over this years Australian Open champion Madison Keys

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: New Zealand v South Africa. Coverage of the group match from Holkar Cricket Stadium, Indore. New Zealand have won the World Cup just once in their history when they beat rivals Australia at the 2000 event, a tournament that they also hosted. South Africa have never won this competition before and have been beaten in the semi-finals on the last two occasions

programme.title: Live World Grand Prix Darts
programme.sub-title: World Grand Prix Darts D1 06.10 Leicester Mattioli Arena
programme.desc: Coverage of day one from Mattioli Arena in Leicester, featuring first-round matches, played over the best of three sets. Luke Littlers tournament came to an early end at this stage last year when he was beaten 2-1 by Rob Cross, and Luke Humphries got his defence of the title under way with a victory over Stephen Bunting by the same scoreline

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Jacksonville Jaguars v Kansas City Chiefs (Kick-off 1.15am). Coverage of the week five match from EverBank Stadium in Jacksonville. programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Shanghai Masters and the WTA Wuhan Open. Coverage of the events at Qizhong Forest Sports City Arena and Optics Valley International Tennis Center respectively. There was an upset in round four in Shanghai last year when David Goffin overcame second seed Alexander Zverev 6-4, 7-5. British interest ended early in the first round in Wuhan 12 months ago when Katie Boulter was beaten 6-2, 7-5 by Lesia Tsurenko

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Shanghai Masters and the WTA Wuhan Open. Coverage of the events at Qizhong Forest Sports City Arena and Optics Valley International Tennis Center respectively. programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: England v Bangladesh. Coverage of the group match from Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati, as Nat Sciver-Brunts side play their second group match. England last won this tournament in 2017 when they beat India in a thrilling final at Lords. Their opponents are playing in just their second World Cup after their first appearance came at the last tournament three years ago

programme.title: Live World Grand Prix Darts
programme.sub-title: World Grand Prix Darts D2 07.10 Leicester Mattioli Arena
programme.desc: Coverage of day two from Mattioli Arena in Leicester, featuring first-round matches, played over the best of three sets. Mike De Decker was the shock champion last year and he got his tournament under way 12 months ago with a 2-1 victory over Damon Heta. Later that night, six-time winner of this event Michael van Gerwen was comprehensively beaten 2-0 by Daryl Gurney

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are looking for treasure in Somersets storage units, where a bouncy castle and an air boat are among the finds

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: A marine machine boils over as Christopher bleeds out, Luke cuts loose as ten tonnes of trouble leaves the team high and dry, and Shaun and Sarah handle a red-hot recovery

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May ask whether the Eastern Bloc countries ever made a good car, and Richard Hammond assesses the performance of German sports model the Veritas. The Ford Fiesta is also put through its paces in a stringent road test, and Mayor of London Boris Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May visits California to learn about the hydrogen-fuelled Honda FCX Clarity, and Jeremy Clarkson assesses the performance of Teslas battery-powered supercar the Roadster. Richard Hammond looks back over 50 years of British touring car racing, and singer Tom Jones is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Secret France
programme.desc: Ricks journey takes him to the Spanish border and the Mediterranean coast. He discovers how Catalan and French influences have shaped the culinary legacy of Roussillon in the foothills of the Pyrenees, and samples some of the areas famous mountain cuisine, including grilled sausages, snails and fresh fish caught in a self-contained seawater lake - all with generous servings of the regions famous garlic mayonnaise. Back in his country kitchen, Rick prepares pork and beef meatballs in a tomato and piment sauce

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create gourmet lunches on a tight budget, receiving tips from one of Britains leading Indian chefs and getting insider advice on buying wine on a shoestring. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise meal for a dinner lady

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guest panellists Jack Dee, Romesh Ranganathan, Gaby Roslin and Tinchy Stryder join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games

programme.title: Will and Ralf Should Know Better
programme.desc: The pair explore supernatural beliefs in a combative adventure where they meet a mind reader, join a coven of witches, and stay over at one of Britains most haunted inns

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Richard Osman, Ellie Taylor, Jessica Knappett, David ODoherty, Rob Beckett and Aisling Bea answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today. Jimmy Carr hosts

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.desc: The game show where treachery lurks around every corner! Tempers rise between the members of the original Laumei tribe, and Dante saves his strength for the immunity challenge.

programme.desc: Britains most talented detectives uncover human trafficking in Bristol, hunt the leader of a county lines gang in Surrey, and trawl through hours of CCTV to stop a vaccine fraudster in London

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Special police task forces tackle violent drug dealers in Gloucestershire, a fraudster in London, and a cruel gang making money illegally trading over two hundred wild birds from a pub

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Luke and his team are called to a farm in Donnybrook, Western Australia, where a 20-tonne excavator known as The Mud Monster is bogged. The owner was trying to build a recreational dam when the machine got stuck and it has been out of action for months now, burning money and holding up construction. Two other companies have failed to remove it and Team Salvage has just 24 hours and a 5,000 dollar budget to get it done

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Luke and his team are contracted to remove two stolen vehicles from an abandoned mine site that has been turned into a recreational lake for weekend campers and water skiers. The missing cars are toxic and they have a 15,000-dollar budget and two days to get the job done

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D is in town and is prepared to risk having his fingers burned for the chance of a big score, while auctioneer Sean Kelly keeps a watchful eye

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the hunters are off to Leeds, where a new pair of bidders arrive - and they are not afraid to throw their weight around. Meanwhile, Sam and Ione re-ignite their feud

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders looking for treasures in Ipswich. With Heavy D back in town the bargaining buccaneers are being driven mad by the booming bidder

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Auctioneer Sean Kelly and his bidders head to Broadstairs in Kent where there are some high quality goods up for auction, including a double car lot

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage get busy with a midnight mission - when multiple machines get into trouble, the crew find themselves on the edge of a breakdown.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Jeremy Clarkson and James May try to find the perfect car for 17-year-olds, dealing with insurance companies, accident repairs and a muddy music festival car park in the process. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. Actor, writer and comedian Stephen Fry is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Secret France
programme.desc: The chef concludes his tour with trips to the Languedoc and Provence. In the border town of Uzes, Rick samples salt cod and marvels at a colourful array of French patisserie - selecting a seasonal fig tart to have with his morning coffee. He moves on to the harbour town of Cassis to try North African lamb chorba cooked by a local fisherman, while back in his country kitchen, he prepares a confit tomato and aubergine tarte tatin

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a restaurant-quality meal on the tightest of budgets. They pick up some insider tips from Michelin-starred chef David Everitt-Matthias, are inspired by the work of celebrated 19th-century cook Alexis Soyer, and put everything theyve learnt into practice when they help three girls say thank you to two people who are very important to them

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Ben Miller, Henning Wehn, Doon Mackichan and Alex Brooker to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas take part in the game show, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts this extended episode, with writer and presenter Richard Osman and Observer columnist Sonia Sodha joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, welcoming Jan Ravens, Jimmy Carr and Clive Anderson to the show, along with regular panellist Alan Davies. The host asks questions on the subject of gifts, awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr, in which guests Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Phil Wang, Gabby Logan and Rosie Jones answer questions based on opinion polls

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on the latest events in news and politics, with the help of Maisie Adam, Eshaan Akbar, Ed Byrne, Sophie Duker and Ed Gamble. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by comedy actors Warwick Davis and Hugh Dennis, comedian Katherine Ryan and journalist John Simpson, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The drama, scheming and backstabbing continue once again as the tribe comes together and decides to exclude a particularly vocal member from participating in camp and strategic talk.

programme.desc: A man keeps his illness a secret as he is worried it might affect his sons future as a dancer, and a furious Greg loses his temper with Rico. Medical drama, starring Felix DAlviella and Ben Jones

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: An ex-Army bouncer finds the courage to ask the doctors for help, while Joe finally manages to get a laugh out of Julia

programme.desc: Chrissies affair with Alistair becomes public knowledge, but she remains defiant, insisting she tried to put an end to it before anyone could get hurt. Meanwhile, Ric is forced to compromise his beliefs in order to raise cash for his student daughter, and Janices marital woes alter the way she deals with the mother of a patient who appears to be guilty of infidelity

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ruth begins the morning in a good mood, but her confidence is knocked when Toby completes a medical procedure that eluded her, and she struggles to deal with her feelings. Curtis is troubled while tending to a boy he appears to know and later lays flowers on a grave. Ian Lavender guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leon is still suffering flashbacks of the traumatic events of the previous day and agrees with Kirsty to regard their night together as a one-off. A pregnant woman is seriously injured in what appears to be a carjacking, and a suspect is traced, but later released for lack of evidence. Leon is sent home after losing his temper with the villain, only to defy orders and take matters into his own hands

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Janines game-playing gets her into trouble with Jack. Meanwhile, Patrick faces heartache, and Jays plan is foiled.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine gets her own back on Jack, leaving him chained to the club. Meanwhile, Bradleys not impressed with his dads idea of entertainment, and has Jay had enough of the Square?

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Hector is so incensed by the sudden arrival of his pregnant daughter Lizzie that he decides to disown her. Meanwhile, Archie races to reconcile his feuding family, and Katrina faces a difficult decision. Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire

programme.title: Londons Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to a hotel fire and discover blocked escape routes threaten the safety of guests. Elsewhere, Sicknote has finally had enough of politics

programme.title: Allo Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and the others make the final preparations for the parade, while the general, the colonel and Gruber play a round of golf, during which they discuss the plot to blow up Hitler

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Short Introduction to Coopers Rules
programme.desc: Local PCs Cooper and Walsh try to master a new crime-fighting technique. However, the duos carefully laid plans unravel when Barry decides to treat a retired vicar to a day trip. Long-running sitcom, starring Ken Kitson and Louis Emerick

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The women of the village are impressed by a series of fanciful tales told by a retired jewel thief about his larcenous exploits in the south of France. However, the scoundrels skills are put to the test when Marina and Miss Davenport seek his aid in helping Auntie Wainwright crack a keyless safe. John Challis guest stars

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective struggles to cope following the death of his wife and suffers more grief when the body of his godson is discovered in a bricked-up drain 12 years after he went missing. Lynley himself becomes a suspect when the boys sister is found dead, forcing him to enlist the help of his lawyer and DS McCaffreys son to prove his innocence. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Nicholas Farrell

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved-crime squad reopens the case of an Asian woman who was attacked eight years ago, and has been in a coma ever since. After enlisting the aid of a community liaison officer, it becomes apparent there is conflict in the victims family, as well as a possible connection with the disappearance of a private detective. Nina Wadia, Keith Allen and Navin Chowdhry guest star

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Beth Bailey is thrown in at the deep end on her first operation with Section D when she is tasked with protecting an influential oil baron whose life is under threat. However, Harry and Lucas are suspicious and, after launching a secret surveillance operation on the magnates mansion, they discover he is planning an attack using a deadly nerve agent, with potentially disastrous consequences. Starring Sophia Myles and Peter Firth

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Madly in love with one of Lady Janes old school friends, Lovejoy finds it hard to keep his mind on work and mistakes a set of fake watercolours for the real thing. While hes off trying to put matters right, Eric takes charge of furnishing Dalrymples stately home - with disastrous results. Joanna Lumley guest stars

Drama, starring Jeremy Edwards and Siobhan Redmond

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ruth feels suicidal again, but her spirits are raised after helping save a life following a motorbike accident. Adam is hurt to discover Jessica is married and Toby receives an ultimatum from an angry Sean, but a kiss from Joanne leaves him elated. Alexander Morton guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Callum and Kirsty answer a call about a disturbance at the home of an elderly widow and discover she has been raped as well as burgled. A neighbour falls under suspicion, but CID have little hope of putting together a case as the victim proves reluctant to undergo a medical examination. The sergeant is also struggling with family problems after learning he may be running out of time to reach a reconciliation with his estranged father

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: As Jack dangles on a chain, will Janine win a prize? And as things hot up between Zainab and Jane in the kitchen, Patrick has found solace at home

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Janes nightmare day goes from bad to worse, Janine makes her first mark on Walford, and Danielle reaches out to Ronnie

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers return to the UK and take up guard duty at Windsor Castle, while also preparing to take part in a memorial ceremony for the anniversary of the D-Day landings

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen

programme.sub-title: All That Glitters Is Not Elvis
programme.desc: When Alvin and Entwistle witness Lance attempting to prove to his wife that Elvis Presley is still alive, the duo feel duty-bound to help him out, and organise for the King himself to make an appearance. Long-running comedy starring Brian Murphy, Burt Kwouk and Kenneth Cope

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When Eva, a worldly wise former acquaintance of Alvin arrives in the village, while Marina discovers she might have some competition as the apple of Howards eye. Long running comedy, guest starring Shirley Ann Field

programme.title: Harry Wild
programme.desc: Recently retired English professor Harriet Harry Wild is trying to adjust to retirement when shes injured in a mugging. While recovering at the home of her police detective son Charlie, she looks at his files and realises his latest investigation bears similarities to an obscure Elizabethan play. But when her findings are rebuffed, she decides to find the killer-with aid from a surprising source. Drama, starring Jane Seymour

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker as DI Annika Strandhed, who has returned to Glasgow to head up the Marine Homicide Unit, where she is tasked with solving puzzling crimes and unexplained murders that wash up in Scotlands waters. On her first day in a new role, Annika is called in to solve the murder of a man found in the Clyde, with a harpoon piercing his head

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopen a 1992 abduction case when the woman who disappeared turns up alive and well, claiming she was never kidnapped in the first place. Halford suspects the apparent victims mother of faking the incident to get her ex-husband to pay the ransom. Drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Learning that the Azakstan Freedom Front is trying to acquire a lethal nerve agent, Harry sends Lucas to help the Russians destroy the sample. However, a member of the AFF travels to London in search of the substance, forcing the team to work quickly and welcome an FSB officer to the grid in a bid to track down the rogue nationalist and prevent the use of a biological weapon that has the potential to wipe out the entire city in hours. Guest starring Julian Lewis Jones (Where the Heart Is)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Derby to meet Rachel and Andy Smith, whose middle child Isaac has a severe form of cerebral palsy. The couple must be available at all times because Isaac sleeps in a hospital bed in the living room, but this is making life difficult for his siblings as their home design is in conflict with what the family really need. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team arrives to help, backed up by an army of local tradespeople - with designer Julia Kendall making sure they do not stray too far from her vision

programme.desc: Three contestants face a pressure test set by Michelin-starred chef Michael Wilson and must recreate his incredible Marguerite Opera dessert, nicknamed The Tower of Terror

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick treats a Persian cat that has been hit by a car, requiring treatments involving a skin graft and putting its crushed bones back together. Meanwhile, a rescue dog has a cancerous tumour in his jaw removed, and a young staffie-cross needs treatment for a developmental elbow disease

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A 10-month-old puppy called Albie is knocked over by a car on a family camping holiday is rushed in as an emergency admission, and Noel Fitzpatrick fears this may be a life or death situation. Elsewhere, a Scottish terrier has a mysterious ailment, and a 16-month-old spaniel, is suffering from severe arthritis affecting both hips

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Its Changeover Day in Val Thorens, which means legions of first-time and out-of-practice skiers hitting the slopes with sometimes disastrous consequences

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Theres a rare crisis in Val Thorens when one of the highest cable cars in the world breaks down, leaving up to 100 people stuck 50 metres above the mountainside

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The two finalists go head to head, each taking on the redesign of a trendy bar in Londons vibrant Soho district. They have three days to make over the ground-floor bar and an intimate basement cocktail lounge - and to help, both contestants have a fellow team-mate, plus a team of trades. One designer goes all-out, relocating the bar to the other side of the room - but the more they rip out, the more it becomes a demolition zone. Down the road, there is indecision and angst as the other finalist realises just how much is at stake. Who will win the career-defining contract to design an upmarket apartment on the Cornish coast?

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: In Dudley, Ash and Jamie blue light to a frightened young woman with severe chest pains. Rachel and Mick are called to assist the police with a prisoner in Stoke

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The team helps a Nottingham family of five who have outgrown the home they love. Mum Julie and dad Trevor have been so busy bringing up their three daughters, theyve let the clutter get out of control. Their three daughters are fed up with the clutter, embarrassed to bring friends over. Nick offers to clear half their belongings in return for a total home makeover

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Dan and Brianne purchased a ranch-style home in Pasadena seven years ago, and its the only one their two young children have ever known

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and the team head to the Worcestershire village of Eckington to help 17-year-old Antonia Payne-Cheney, who has Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, a rare and debilitating condition that causes her joints to regularly dislocate and means she cannot eat normally and is fed through a tube. The ambitious build features a functional, sterile space for medical procedures in her bedroom, a specially adapted wet room and an accessible area where she can socialise with friends and family

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The contestants get one more shot at immunity in an Alphabet Lucky Dip Challenge

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Emergency workers rush to the aid of a man who is struggling to breathe after injecting himself

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: First-time parents Rochalla and her unflappable partner Craig arrive 10 days overdue. Her shock pregnancy defied medical odds as she conceived just weeks after an aggressive course of chemotherapy. Cameras also follow train driver Kieron and his wife Joanne, who find it hard to kick their clockwatching habit during labour. While self-confessed ladies man Michael and partner Natalia prepare for the arrival of her fourth child

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The dads are under the spotlight at Liverpool Womens Hospital as three very different men prepare for fatherhood. Midwife Kirsty looks after Rebecca and Jack, a soldier whos more confident about going into battle than he is about changing nappies. Mum Billie arrives with her ex-partner Nathan, and although theyre apart, they hope they can raise their child together. Cameras also follow John, who has always wanted to be a dad. He hopes some of his broodiness will rub off on girlfriend Natalie

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Its the famous Varsity Week, when rival Oxbridge universities hit town for a downhill grudge match - alongside the usual dramatic backdrop of cases from the slopes of Val Thorens

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Patrol teams work to prevent avalanches, using dynamite, train their rescue dogs, and desperately seek a 14-year-old boy who is missing after skiing off-piste alone

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete to get their big break in the world of commercial interior design. For their first challenge, head judge Michelle Ogundehin asks them to transform five upmarket rental apartments in Manchester. Working in pairs, the designers must take on a living room or master bedroom, and then work together on a shared home office

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Anna and Stuart rush to the home of a former soldier who has fallen down some stairs and has a potential spinal injury. Ben and Laura attend a young boy with suspected appendicitis

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a thousand-mile journey from the Swedish capital of Stockholm to Abisko in the northern reaches of the Arctic Circle. In Stockholm, Michael braves a precarious tour of the city from its rooftops before boarding a heritage tram to get the lowdown on 1930s Sweden from an expert. Moving on, he finishes his journey deep in the Arctic Circle at a remote climate research station. He also has lunch with traditional Sami people in Vilhelmina and checks into an ice hotel

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo examines the history of the American rail network, using Appletons General Guide to the United States and Canada of 1879 to plot his course. He begins on Manhattan Island and travels from Grand Central Terminal to the site of Ground Zero

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. Its a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Robs colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from the Royal Hall, Harrogate, where Phillip Mould examines an ink drawing that he believes may have been made by Picasso. John Axford challenges Fiona to guess the odd one out from four tea bowls, and Jon Baddeley values a model ship that took more than 30 years to build

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum. Finds brought in to be valued include some jewellery from the art deco era, a painting by artistic group the Glasgow Girls, and an ugly family heirloom that turns out to have been made by a very important historical figure - and is worth far more than its owners suspected

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drags a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium

John Axford challenges Fiona to guess the odd one out from four tea bowls, and Jon Baddeley values a model ship that took more than 30 years to build

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the explorer travels through Cornwall as its emerges from the first lockdown, discovering the impact of Covid-19 on a part of the country highly reliant on tourism. Simon discovers the ongoing impact of the collapse of the tin-mining industry in the 1980s when he visits one of Britains poorest estates, and meets the entrepreneurs who sell homemade food on the beach who are struggling to make enough money to last the winter

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the adventurers journey takes him from Oman to the Maldives. He starts in the Strait of Hormuz, where oil from the Gulf is shipped through the narrow channel, then moves on to Mumbai, the oceans biggest port. In the Maldives, Simon finds arguably the most beautiful collection of tropical coral islands in the world - but the fragile underwater environment is a barometer for the changing nature of the sea, as he witnesses how bleaching has damaged the coral and an entire island has been manufactured as a landfill dump to deal with the problem of rubbish

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the beautiful and unique landscapes of the Lake District, beginning by meeting Cumbrians with different visions for the future of Englands biggest national park. He talks to members of a campaign group trying to protect the remaining red squirrels, a traditional farmer who feels that his ancient way of life is on the point of extinction, and an 18-year-old student who runs a 1,500-acre farm

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drags a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. Its a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon and Henry head to an old Second World War airfield in Wiltshire. Simon decides to restore a 1970s caravan while Henry opts for a boat

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring Oradour-sur-Glane, a French town drenched in infamy. Also, Alcatraz, a facility famed for breakouts but also subjected to a daring break-in

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes in Georgia and Azerbaijan as he journeys through the former Russian empire. He begins in the port of Batumi, discovers a surprise 19th-century tea plantation in the West Georgian countryside, visits a private museum dedicated to Joseph Stalin - the most infamous Georgian of all - and discovers that a Briton was the first to conquer the highest mountain in the Caucasus range. Arriving in Azerbaijan, he learns about its role in the 19th-century oil industry

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his great American trek, following his copy of Appletons General Guide east from Manhattan to Long Island, and visits Brooklyn to hear the story of the construction of the worlds first suspension bridge. Below ground, he investigates New York Citys inaugural subway, and the dangers faced by the sandhogs who built it. Progressing along the Long Island Railroad to Queens, Michael takes in an ambitious engineering project and a model town built by an Irish immigrant who became one of Americas richest men. Later, he heads to the islands Gold Coast, where he relives the fun of the roaring twenties at Oheka Castle, and concludes this leg of his trip at the Montauk lighthouse on Long Islands eastern-most tip

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows Americas iconic River Hudson, beginning at New York Citys Penn Station, where he rides on the national rail carrier service, Amtrak. At Tarrytown, he hears a famous American ghost story, the Legend of Sleepy Hollow, and on the east bank of the Hudson he stops at Garrison, where he hears about the greatest turncoat in American history. In Poughkeepsie, the presenter visits a university built just for women, before arriving in New Yorks state capital, Albany, where he samples Albany Ale and meets the State Senator

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves in Lincolnshire picking up a 1935 Riley Falcon - a good-looking saloon car, with a pre-select gearbox

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek brings a small army of military hardware to Thornton le Dale including a Studebaker Weasel tracked vehicle and a WWII-era Willys Jeep

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Hanbury Hall in Droitwich. Among the rarities brought in to be valued are a jacket designed by Peter Blake, which proves less valuable for being nibbled by a ferret, a nude painting and a sketch of Napoleon on his deathbed. Andy McConnell examines the oldest piece of glass he has seen in his career, and Fiona is challenged to spot a 2500-year-old Greek vessel among three fakes

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where the experts value a selection of rare finds from the regions historic potteries, as well as a brooch that belonged to flying ace Amy Johnson and a portable road map. Plus, Fiona is challenged to spot the cheap imitation in a collection of gold necklaces

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek auctions off a Jensen Interceptor and a Jensen Healey along with a one-off Wood and Pickett Triumph Dolomite Sprint. Sarah takes a shine to a four-tonne road roller

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the conclusion of his two-part journey, Simon investigates the environmental challenges facing Cornwall and the rest of the country. He discovers how the regions farmers are adopting new, less intensive approaches that are both more profitable and environmentally friendly, and reveals how reintroducing beavers to the uplands could tackle the problem of widespread flooding. He also encounters some of the countys iconic wildlife, including grey seals that live in constant risk of getting caught up in discarded fishing nets

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus buy a Porsche 923 with a cracked interior, bad paintwork and ripped seats. This driving legend is well past its best, but they still hope to turn a profit

programme.desc: The documentary charting the day-to-day realities faced by workers in the NHS returns, picking up with staff at St Marys Hospital in London on March 22nd 2017, the day of the Westminster terror attack. St Marys is one of the capitals four Major Trauma Centres, and staff are well-versed in Major Incident Protocols that come into effect in the wake of events such as terrorist activity. Arrangements are made to transfer some of the hospitals critically ill patients to a sister site at Charring Cross, giving the AandE team more scope to help the victims, including teenagers Yann and Victor; French students in London on a school trip. Also admitted is Stephen, who needs immediate surgery to save his leg, and his wife Cara shares her thoughts on the helplessness felt by the families of those most gravely injured as a result of these incidents

programme.title: Ana Kriegel: A Young Life Lost
programme.desc: In May 2018, Russian-Irish teenager Ana Kriegel was lured from her home and brutally killed in a derelict house in Lucan. The awful crime was all the more disturbing when her killers were revealed to be two 13-year-old boys - now the youngest convicted murderers in the history of the state. Here, senior journalists, barristers and family friends tell Anas story, looking at the circumstances around her murder, the extensive Garda investigation and the trial that followed. Featuring a series of new photographs released by Anas family, the documentary also examines the sentencing in this unprecedented case and explores the lasting impact of Anas death

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Drama following people from all walks of life during the first year of the Second World War, beginning in the run-up to its outbreak. American journalist and broadcaster Nancy Campbell makes a grisly discovery at the Polish-German border, while in Manchester, Lois waits for news of her translator boyfriend Harry. However, Lois is unaware that Harry has a secret Polish lover, Kasia, and he has vowed to help her flee from Warsaw. Starring Sean Bean, Helen Hunt, Lesley Manville, Julia Brown and Jonah Hauer-King

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A father is aghast to read tales of wild romance in his teenage daughters diary, failing to realise they are all fictitious. David inherits a ventriloquists dummy complete with a schedule of bookings, and decides the show must go on. Meanwhile, Gina finds herself attracted to a charismatic guest. Nostalgic drama, starring David Lonsdale and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team create an unusual BandB in Devon for Michele and Tobin, who want to turn their tired summerhouse into a property that could accommodate four-legged guests

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A dark family secret comes to light when a female hit-and-run suspect claims the woman she deliberately ran over on a pedestrian crossing was a ghost. However, the facts of the case tell a different story. Gwen Taylor guest stars, with Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie and the team revisit Adie and Tone in Yeovil, Somerset, to help clear the remainder of their clutter. Plus, antiques restorer and dealer Peter is ready to start a new chapter in his life but needs to get rid of his hoard first

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A single mother from Sunderland asks Kavanagh to prosecute the neighbourhood vigilante she suspects of attempting to murder her teenage tearaway son in a hit-and-run incident. At first he has misgivings about accepting a case so far from home, but finally agrees _ only to find his already strained family life suffering as a result. Tense legal drama, starring John Thaw and Lisa Harrow, with a guest appearance by Robert Glenister

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.desc: The barrister examines two more real-life cases, including that of Darrell Simester, who was held against his will for 13 years on a farm in Newport, Wales. Plus, the case of Paul Roylance, who stole the money left to his mother Shelley when his father lost his life to cancer

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An accidental shooting at Ashfordly Hall prompts Bellamy to investigate reports accusing acting estate manager Richard Bentham of exploiting youngsters for child labour, but his enquiries reveal a far more complicated situation. Peggy discovers a promising new source of revenue when she realises there is a market for guided tours of the area, but her excitement is cut short by a terrifying encounter. Rural drama, guest starring former Emmerdale actor Peter Amory, with Mark Jordon, Rupert Vansittart and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: The Deal Makers
programme.desc: Following the biggest characters from the world of pawn broking as they uncover the stories behind the most amazing objects being bought, sold and loaned against

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aprils life is in tatters, while Gabby and Vinnys relationship is in danger and Charity hides her guilt

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Todd frets over Theos disappearance, Bethany makes a surprise return to Weatherfield, Christina learns Glendas opinion of her, and Carla confides her doubts about Beckys story to Kit

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Todd frets over Theos disappearance, Bethany makes a surprise return to Weatherfield, Christina learns Glendas opinion of her, and Carla confides her doubts about Beckys story to Kit

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A frantic mother and father bring their daughter to the Royal for whooping cough treatment, and Cheriton is shocked to hear the girl hasnt been vaccinated. When the girl dies the worried staff have to cope with an influx of children in need of immunisation. Mr Rose reveals he intends to operate on himself, and Ormerod pays a home visit to Mrs Lyons. Medical drama, guest starring Honor Blackman

programme.title: Murder in Provence
programme.desc: Now working as a consultant for the police, Marine helps Antoine and Helene investigate the death of an aristocrat found dead at his crumbling chateau, but just when the team think that theyve got their suspects nailed, another body is found. Roger Allam and Nancy Carroll star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A local man confesses to a girls murder of 11 years previously, prompting Sgt Miller to reopen the case. A search fails to uncover the victims body, but the investigation takes an intriguing twist when PC Younger unearths a male skeleton instead. Meanwhile, Peggy sets her sights on a wealthy widower. Rural drama, guest starring Graham Turner and Geoffrey Hutchings, with John Duttine, Steven Blakeley and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross throws himself into fighting for Neds liberty as George prepares to marry Cecily and finalise his deal with Hanson and Merceron. Geoffrey Charles is forced to make a desperate plan to elope with Cecily before the wedding, and Demelza uncovers a theft at the mine. Sams growing attachment to Rosina comes under threat by Tesss claim to seek a purer life and with Neds trial looming large and the odds stacked against them, Ross pleads for Dwights help in a daring attempt to save his friend

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Asha resorts to extreme measures to escape her mental struggles, Tim picks up a former girlfriend in his cab, and Todd berates Theo for doing a disappearing act

programme.title: Bodyguard
programme.desc: David makes a major breakthrough as he goes in search of the truth behind the attack on Julia. However, his interference in the case has placed him in mortal danger, and he comes to realise that there is no one left who believes his story. With time rapidly running out, he faces a battle to prove his innocence in the face of mounting evidence against him. Jed Mercurios six-part political thriller comes to a conclusion with an extended final episode. Starring Richard Madden, Gina McKee and Nina Toussaint-White

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Wealthy family members lose their fortune after being defrauded by their business manager and move to the small town they bought for their son as a joke birthday gift in 1991. First episode of the comedy, starring Eugene Levy

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny searches for permission from the mayor to sell the town, while David and Alexis enjoy a night out with the locals

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is suspected of being a hit-and-run driver, while Vernon is hired to escort two singers to a gig - but soon discovers he has an aversion to loud music and offloads the responsibility onto David, who is no match for the conniving pair

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: In Monmouthshire in South Wales, Simon Parfett and his team take on a 1980s double decker bus conversion for recycling centre worker Stacy

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The discovery of a local landowners body throws suspicion on two of his tenants, a couple who have previously been threatened with violence for refusing to move out of their cottage. Rather than stay and face the music they disappear, and Wycliffe realises if he does not get to them before the victims family, the consequences could be deadly. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd and Jimmy Yuill

programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie travels to Staffordshire to meet an entrepreneur whose hoard of ceramics and glass is taking over her home. Plus, a man from Shropshire, who owns an extensive collection of army tanks, is challenged to transform his mechanical mess into money at auction

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Ormerod rushes to help following a boating accident but realises hes been sent to the wrong location, and when he finally arrives at the disaster scene his efforts to save a mans life prove futile. Meanwhile, PC Ventress brings two men found fighting over a girl to the Royal, where one promptly collapses due to a brain haemorrhage. Weatherill faces a testing time when she helps deliver a baby and nurse Meryl reveals she may be pregnant. Medical drama series, starring Robert Daws, Michelle Hardwick and Julian Ovenden

programme.title: Murder in Provence
programme.desc: A love affair seems to be at the heart of a womans death in the town of Eguilles, but Antoine, Marine and Helene think it might be connected to the discovery of an older womans body at a vineyard kilometres away. They investigate the men in the two womens lives to discover what was done to them and why. Starring Roger Allam and Nancy Carroll

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A group of young offenders come to stay at Ashfordly Hall, but soon find themselves under suspicion after a spate of disturbances in the village. Meanwhile, Blaketon and Ventress go on the hunt for a spinsters missing dog, and a £50 reward gives Peggy an idea. Rural drama, starring Rupert Vansittart, William Simons, Derek Fowlds and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Young physiotherapist Lizzie Faulkner is shot dead while enjoying a holiday at a luxury country retreat. The resulting murder investigation unearths betrayal, guilt and the desire for atonement - as Vera moves quickly to avoid another tragedy, and Joe tries to make amends with the demons of his past. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Paul Ritter and Eva Quinn

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sarah receives a letter confirming the date of a scan, while Chas tries to make Charity see sense. Nicola, Jimmy and the kids move in with an aghast Laurel

programme.title: Yorkshire Airport
programme.desc: Cameras focus on life at Leeds Bradford airport during the summer of 2018. It may not be the UKs biggest, but what it lacks in size, it makes up for in ambition. With owners having green-lit a multi-million pound investment, the airport is undergoing a huge makeover. There are also problems for the staff due to an emergency landing after a planes cockpit warning alarm shows its door is still open. Meanwhile, terminal manager Nathan has to deal with a blocked international arrivals door. Hugh Dennis narrates

programme.title: Yorkshire Airport
programme.desc: The airline auditors pay a surprise visit to Leeds Bradford airport, which leaves baggage boys Jimmy and Michael in fear for their jobs when they manage to lose a piece of luggage. Duty manager Nathan has to deal with a flood in the toilets next to an executive departure lounge, and new recruit Gabby faces a trial by fire at the Departure Gate. She has to tell the members of an irate family that they will not be sitting together on their flight to Palma, and struggles to control the ensuing confrontation

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: A London IT consultant looks for love by exploring the homes of three women, assisted by a childhood friend. He is looking for a woman who will share his love of fashion, reading and going to the gym, while the homes he visits feature glitzy silver decor, a large number of books and a collection of dolls heads

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Daryl, a maybe bricklayer from Surrey with a pet iguana and a love of fish, looks for the perfect match by exploring the homes of three women, with his sister providing expert advice. He has to choose between a horse fanatic with a taste for beige decor, an art lover, and a woman with a passion for dragons who already sees herself as a potential bride. Narrated by Rochelle Humes

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: The weekly final sees chefs Galton Blackiston, Frances Atkins, Rupert Rowley and Theo Randall pair up with their chosen home cook partners and go head to head in the ultimate pro-am cooking competition. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund.
